author: daniel.friedman
title: Plug-n-Play NFT/GameFi Toolkit
description: コーディングなしでNFTベースのPlay-to-earn/GameFiコンテンツやゲームをCardano上で作成する、簡単で経済的かつ効果的な方法はありません。

f6_assessments.q0: The proposal's problem statement and solution are aligned with the challenge which is there are no easy or economical way to create nft for games without coding, therefore the solution is to create a no code toolkit for creators and brand to easily build games on Cardano. This proposal clearly states how it will add value to Cardano however they did not mention on how many people does this project aims to help, explain how many people that this project aims to bring onboard Cardano and what will success metric look like (example : aiming for 100000 users within 1 year after V1.0 delivered)? Furthermore, what is the long term plan for the toolkit after it is delivered? Will there any other functions that will be added for future demands of the market? Will it be able to scale to address future challenges?
f6_assessments.q1: The proposer provided evidence of relevant skills and experience needed to implement the proposal. The proposer also knows in an identifiable manner the type and number of team members required to implement the project. Moreover, the budget is outlined clearly and broken down into identifiable terms. The proposer also offers realistic timetable to complete the work. Furthermore, the proposer also provides a sensible and conductible plan for implementation. However the proposer did not mention of any risks and challenges in completing this project. What will be the plan if there is unforeseen problem occur during the development of the toolkit?
f6_assessments.q2: The proposer provided a clear roadmap with milestones and a time horizon for achievement. This proposal also provide links to their social media accounts for the voters to engage and keep track of the progress. While the proposal key metrics of success is solely focused on the delivery of the toolkit, it does not state on how many people will this toolkit aims to bring onboard Cardano. Write an estimation on how many people this toolkit aims to bring to Cardano.

f6_assessments.q0: Making an NFT game is not easy at all, but if this team can make a platform that help game developer just come then select to launch a game. Everything changed! This proposal is about a tool kit that you can create NFT based P2E game on Cardano by yourself without coding. Surely, this project will make a big impact only on the Cardano gaming community, but also inspire other developers in other industries on Cardano network.
f6_assessments.q1:
As again, making an NFT game is not easy, so making a platform for other people to make NFT games is a complex idea that needs a lot of work. The team provided some great key metrics and goals, and they showed a list of needed features for their platform. But the Catalyst needs more about the implementation that the team doesn't provide yet. Their roadmap in the proposal is only the list of group activities/ features that the team plan to do without a specific timeline. 
Moreover, they don't even provide any budget breakdown to show which one of activity or jobs in the project will use how much money. Sadly, I really love this idea but just only assess it at low feasibility.
f6_assessments.q2: We can't audit this proposal because there is nothing. After funding, the team will have to report regularly to Catalyst their progress, hence, the team must provide a roadmap and key metrics for CA/ vCA assesses that is available to audit this project. The more detail in the roadmap the easier on audit and we love it more than a roadmap with just a few headlines without detail. Or the team can explain more about the roadmap in another part of the proposal then just summary it again. Of course, the key metrics must be fitted with the challenge given as first, if not it's failed from impact assessment.

f6_assessments.q0: Apparently the proposal is fit into this challenge. However I'm looking forward to see the future development of that game which might be more attractive and creative game (the games listed in phase 1: Runner, Stacker, Cooking, Rhythm, Puzzle, Arcade Shooter are fine but they're not new so there is risk that it's not attractive to users).
f6_assessments.q1: The team already success with another NFT platform, and they present well in a concise way how they will do it (with plan in phases). The Lovelace Metaverse community is a great starting advantage can help them to be success if they make good use of it.
f6_assessments.q2: The proposal includes roadmap but not include KPIs to measure the success. I think they lack the KPI that how many users they want to attract to play their game in a period of time, or how many ADA that be used through the game. These KPIs are crucial to measure the success of a game project as they launch on the market.

f6_assessments.q0: With crypto blockchains continually growing at rapid speed, projects are looking for the best ways for them to integrate effectively into the blockchain platforms without having the trouble of figuring it out themselves. Bridging services has become an important part of the crypto ecosystem especially for gaming and it is good to see Lovelace find a space that needs to be filled
f6_assessments.q1:
The team has experience in building and selling one of the earliest, most successful NFT platforms.
I believe lovelace.world with your current partnerships and development of Metaverse-as-a Service toolkit will help bolster mass adoption in the Cardano blockchain.
f6_assessments.q2: The Metaverse as a Service idea is a brilliant one but I think we need more insight into how that toolkit will work. Will people stake for access to it? Will they be able to use it themselves or will it be on a case by case basis depending on partnerships with specific projects or companies? Can anyone use it?

solution: クリエイターやブランドは、Lovelaceのコード不要のツールキットを使って、カルダノ上でNFTベースのP2Eゲームを作成し、メタバースでコミュニティに参加します。
experience: 私たちのチームは、最も早く、最も成功したNFTプラットフォームの1つを構築・販売し、次世代のNFTマーケットプレイスとスマートコントラクトを開発しました。
